intro.title: Ready to start your Developer Journey?
intro.text: Just like a chef needs a cooking environment and a carpenter needs a woodworking environment, so does a developer need a **development environment**. If you're **serious** about becoming a Software Developer - which is awesome - then you need to setup your development environment before getting down to business.

steps.title: Step 1. Install Your Code Editor
steps.text: This is where you will spend most of your time a Software Developer. Think of a Code Editor as a glorified Microsoft Word for writing code. As a matter of fact, the best and coolest - and free - code editor out there is **Visual Studio Code**, from Microsoft. Press the download button below to go and download it now.

steps.title: Step 2. Install Your Terminal
steps.text: The second most useful tool in your developer arsenal is your Terminal. This is where you will type in commands, at **the command prompt**, and interact with your development environment. Go ahead and download **Hyper** - a free and awesome Terminal. Press the download button below to go and download it now.

steps.title: Step 3. Install Your JavaScript Engine
steps.text: You will be coding in **JavaScript** so that means you need a way to run JavaScript code on your computer. This is where **Node.js** comes in. It is a JavaScript engine that rocks. Press the download button below to go and download it now.

steps.title: Step 4. Install Your Blockchain Wallet
steps.text: Because Carmel is a Blockchain platform, specifically using the EOS blockchain, you will need a Blockchain Wallet to make the most of Carmel. **Carmel loves Scatter**, the most advanced wallet out there. Oh and it's free too. Press the download button below to go and download it now.

text.mac:
You're now ready to install Chunky on your machine. **Woohoo!** Now just **open up your Terminal** (Step 2, remember?) and just type:

```npm i -g chunky-cli```
text.linux:
You're now ready to install Chunky on your machine. **Woohoo!** Now just **open up your Terminal** (Step 2, remember?) and just type:

```npm i -g chunky-cli```
text.windows:
You're now ready to install Chunky on your machine. **Woohoo!** Now just **open up your Terminal** (Step 2, remember?) and just type:

```npm i -g --production --add-python-to-path windows-build-tools && npm i -g chunky-cli```

steps.title: Amazing! You did it!
steps.text:
Now go back to that terminal and type:

```chunky carmel say hello```

As soon you do that, this screen will automatically update. Cool, eh? :)
